item.title: 法国 Altice 达成债权人协议，削减 86 亿欧元债务
item.description: Altice France SA 与大多数债权人达成协议，将把这家法国电信公司的债务削减 86 亿欧元（约合 90 亿美元）。【原文：Altice France SA and a majority of its creditors have reached an agreement that would slash the French telecommunications company’s debt by €8.6 billion ($9 billion).】

item.title: 特朗普担忧加剧，台湾下调 2025 年经济增长预期
item.description: 台湾下调了对今年经济增长的预测，表明其担心特朗普政府的政策对其经济的影响。【原文：Taiwan lowered its prediction for growth this year, signaling its concern about the impact of the Trump administration’s policies on its economy.】

item.title: Sibanye 退出内华达锂业合资企业
item.description: Sibanye Stillwater Ltd. 取消了在澳大利亚 Ioneer Ltd. 开发的美国大型锂矿中持有主要股份的计划。【原文：Sibanye Stillwater Ltd. scrapped plans to take a major stake in a large US lithium mine being developed by Australia’s Ioneer Ltd.】

item.title: 特朗普关税威胁考验欧盟打击苹果和美达的决心
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）威胁要对损害美国一些大公司利益的罚款进行报复，欧盟打击硅谷势力的决心将受到极限考验。【原文：The European Union’s resolve to take on the might of Silicon Valley is set to be tested to the limit after Donald Trump threatened retaliation for fines that hurt some of America’s biggest companies.】

item.title: 南非数据改革后通胀加速
item.description: 南非统计局修订了用于计算家庭支出的数据后，南非通胀率加速上升，使决策者有理由对下月降息持谨慎态度。【原文：South African inflation accelerated after the statistics office revised the data used to calculate household expenditure, giving policymakers reason to be cautious about cutting interest rates next month.】

item.title: 分析师称泰铢走强将面临泰国降息的阻力
item.description: 在泰国央行意外下调基准利率后，泰国货币的强势预计将有所缓和。【原文：Thailand’s currency is expected to moderate in strength after the nation’s central bank unexpectedly cut its benchmark interest rate.】

item.title: Neuberger Berman 为新房地产基金融资 10 亿美元
item.description: Neuberger Berman 集团为其最新的房地产私募股权二级基金募集了 10.5 亿美元，超出目标约 30%。【原文：Neuberger Berman Group has raised $1.05 billion for its latest real estate private equity secondary fund, exceeding its target by about 30%.】

item.title: 印尼与苹果公司达成协议，标志着 iPhone 禁售令终结
item.description: 苹果公司与印度尼西亚签署了一项投资协议，为在这个东南亚最大的国家恢复销售 iPhone 16 铺平了道路。【原文：Apple Inc. has signed an agreement with Indonesia to invest in the country, paving the way for sales of the iPhone 16 to resume in Southeast Asia’s largest nation.】

item.title: 德国财政部长认为国防开支大有可为
item.description: 德国看守财政部长约尔格-库基斯（Joerg Kukies）表示，即使在新一届议会于下月宣誓就职之前，德国立法者也可能采取行动增加国防开支。【原文：German lawmakers could move to ramp up defense spending even before a new parliament is sworn in next month, according to the country’s caretaker finance minister, Joerg Kukies.】

item.title: Seven & i 管理层收购谈判因管理层控制权问题陷入僵局
item.description: 熟悉内情的人士称，由于在 7-Eleven 私有化后由谁控制该公司的问题上存在分歧，提议对 Seven & i 控股公司进行 9 万亿日元（约合 600 亿美元）管理层收购的财团内部谈判陷入僵局。【原文：Negotiations within the consortium proposing a ¥9 trillion ($60 billion) management buyout of Seven & i Holdings Co. have stalled over disagreements on who will control the 7-Eleven operator after it’s taken private, people familiar with the matter said.】

item.title: 香港 2025 年财政预算案的赢家和输家
item.description: 由于政府计划在人工智能研究领域进行投资，香港的科技企业将从该市的年度预算中获益。【原文：Hong Kong’s technology enterprises are set to benefit from the city’s annual budget as the government plans to roll out investments in artificial intelligence research.】

item.title: 据说中国电动卡车制造商知豆计划斥资 2 亿美元在香港上市
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，中国电动卡车制造商智子汽车科技股份有限公司正在考虑在香港进行首次公开募股，可能募集约2亿美元资金。【原文：Chinese electric truckmaker Zhizi Automobile Technology Co. is considering an initial public offering in Hong Kong that could raise about $200 million, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 世界银行称津巴布韦可通过大胆改革清偿欠款
item.description: 世界银行（World Bank）表示，如果津巴布韦实施财政改革，它就可以清偿拖欠的债务，并重新偿还 210 亿美元的债务，这些债务使津巴布韦在超过四分之一个世纪的时间里一直被国际资本市场拒之门外。【原文：Zimbabwe could clear its arrears and rework $21 billion in debt that’s kept it locked out of international capital markets for more than a quarter of a century if it implements fiscal reforms, the World Bank said.】

item.title: 中国计划至少 550 亿美元增加银行资本
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，中国计划在未来几个月内开始对几家最大的银行进行资本重组，以落实去年为支撑陷入困境的经济而推出的广泛刺激计划。【原文：China plans to start re-capitalizing several of its biggest banks in coming months, according to people familiar with the matter, following through on a broad stimulus package unveiled last year to shore up the struggling economy.】

item.title: 国际金融研究所（IIF）称，2024 年全球债务将增至约 7 万亿美元，创历史新高
item.description: 据国际金融研究所称，2024 年全球债务将增加约 7 万亿美元，达到 318 万亿美元，创下年度新高，这也是金融市场保持谨慎的一个原因。【原文：Global debt increased by around $7 trillion in 2024 to reach $318 trillion, a record annual high and a reason for financial markets to be cautious, according to the Institute of International Finance.】

item.title: 泰国意外降息，增长风险加剧
item.description: 在经济增长数据令人失望、总理和国际货币基金组织公开呼吁降低借贷成本之后，泰国央行出人意料地四个月来首次下调了关键利率。【原文：The Bank of Thailand unexpectedly cut its key interest rate for the first time in four months, acting after disappointing growth data and public calls for lower borrowing costs from both the prime minister and the International Monetary Fund.】

item.title: 基础设施遭袭后乌克兰将提高天然气进口量
item.description: 据乌克兰最大的私营能源公司估计，乌克兰今年将需要购买 10 亿至 20 亿立方米天然气，为下一个供暖季做准备。【原文：Ukraine will have to buy between 1 billion and 2 billion cubic meters of gas this year to prepare for next heating season, the nation’s largest private energy company estimates.】

item.title: 利润下滑 70% 后，Stellantis 发布谨慎展望
item.description: Stellantis NV 认为今年的盈利能力不会有太大改善，因为该汽车制造商正在努力重振下滑的销售业绩，同时寻找新的首席执行官。【原文：Stellantis NV sees little improvement in profitability this year as the automaker struggles to revive flagging sales while searching for a new chief executive officer.】

item.title: 富时 100 指数直播：英国股市将反弹，英镑下跌
沙特化工巨头意外录得季度亏损
item.description: 沙特化工巨头沙特沙比克公司（Sabic）报告称，2024 年最后一个季度出现了意外亏损，这表明该公司仍在与长期的行业低迷作斗争。【原文：Saudi chemicals giant Sabic reported a surprise loss in the final quarter of 2024 in a sign the company is still struggling with a prolonged industry downturn.】

item.title: 达能在销量增长的帮助下实现销售额恢复性增长
item.description: 达能集团（Danone SA）报告称，受北美销量增长的推动，去年最后几个月的销售额有所回升。【原文：Danone SA reported resilient sales in the final months of last year, buoyed by growth in volumes in North America.】

item.title: 慕尼黑再保险公司盈利超预期，计划支付 46 亿欧元
item.description: 尽管第四季度盈利略有下降，但慕尼黑再保险公司仍实现了去年的盈利目标，为这家德国再保险公司向投资者返还 46 亿欧元（48 亿美元）铺平了道路。【原文：Munich Re beat its profit target for last year despite a slight drop in fourth-quarter earnings, paving the way for the German reinsurer to return €4.6 billion ($4.8 billion) to investors.】

item.title: 随着欧洲电气化进程的推进，EON 今年将把投资额提高 15
item.description: EON SE 今年将把支出提高 15%，因为这家德国公用事业公司希望从能源转型和数据中心的连接需求中获利。【原文：EON SE will boost spending this year by 15% as the German utility seeks to profit from the energy transition and demand for connections from data centers.】

item.title: 德国电信盈利前景因欧洲市场下滑而不及预期
item.description: 德国电信公司（Deutsche Telekom AG）预计 2025 年的利润将低于分析师的预期，因为欧洲市场的价格战愈演愈烈，抑制了去年的增长。【原文：Deutsche Telekom AG forecast profit for 2025 below analysts’ estimates after price wars sprang up in European markets, dampening growth last year.】

item.title: 法国期待美国在乌克兰停火后提供支持
item.description: 法国财政部长埃里克-隆巴德（Eric Lombard）表示，一旦乌克兰与俄罗斯达成停火协议，他希望美国能为欧洲军队提供支援，帮助维护和平。【原文：French Finance Minister Eric Lombard said he expects the US to provide backup for European troops to help maintain peace once a ceasefire is agreed between Ukraine and Russia.】

item.title: 汇丰在首席执行官的重大改革中任命亚洲区及银行业务负责人
item.description: 汇丰银行控股有限公司（HSBC Holdings Plc）在精简和撤消管理层的同时，赋予亚洲一些较小市场的国家主管更多职责。【原文：HSBC Holdings Plc gave country heads in some smaller Asian markets additional responsibilities as the lender streamlines and removes management layers.】

item.title: 欧洲银行警告环境、社会和公司治理的突然撤退隐藏着信用风险
item.description: 欧洲银行业联合会警告说，拟议中的集团环境、社会和公司治理（ESG）规则的倒退规模之大，将使贷款人更难分析信贷风险。【原文：The European Banking Federation is warning that the sheer scale of a proposed rollback of the bloc’s ESG rules will make it harder for lenders to analyze credit risk.】

item.title: 欧盟将向在竞争中挣扎的行业推介清洁新政
item.description: 欧盟将公布一项提高欧盟竞争力的计划，因为欧盟各行业正在努力平衡雄心勃勃的气候目标和来自美国和中国日益激烈的竞争。【原文：The European Union will unveil a plan to improve the bloc’s competitiveness as its industries struggle to balance ambitious climate targets and increasing rivalry from the US and China.】

item.title: 香港将降低低端住宅交易的物业税
item.description: 香港政府将降低部分廉价住宅的印花税，这是香港政府为提振低迷的房地产市场所做的最新尝试。【原文：The Hong Kong government will lower the stamp duty for some cheap homes in its latest attempt to boost the lackluster property market.】

item.title: 中国前疾控中心主任抨击马斯克削减DOGE是 "反科学 "行为
item.description: 在美国总统唐纳德-特朗普的特别顾问削减美国科研预算作为其削减联邦开支努力的一部分之后，中国疾病预防控制中心前主任指责埃隆-马斯克损害了科学。【原文：The former head of China’s CDC has accused Elon Musk of hurting science after the special adviser to President Donald Trump cut the US budget for scientific research as part of his efforts to slash federal spending.】
